review_content: Bermuda stays dormant till mid May.  Had used drop spreader expensive applications before now.  Really didn't work that well. All's the lawn and garden center had to say is "Oh well clover was really bad this year.  Their $50 bag did nothing.  Cheap products would have worked better.  This spray did extremely well. The chickweed and clover just exploded in one week.  This makes it difficult for the Bermuda to really come out at it's best when mid May comes.  This should really give it a head start.  Best week killer I have ever used.  It has not rained in a week and this is 6 days after application.  It is killing the chickweed, clover and onions.  I will see how the Bermuda does and give another review, but the pictures tell it all.  Well the bermuda came out better than ever.  It specifically says use two applications yearly.  If you use it twice in a short time well duh!!! its going to kill your grass.  Use as directed and it worked well for me.  I am going to spray once more early this spring and probably again in early June.  All the lawn services say that spraying is better.  With the drop spreader stuff I would wet the grass and also spray it with dawn to hold it on the leaf, didn't work even with overlapping spreads. review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2023
review_content: This product was recommended by a friend who has a nice lawn.  He said that it did a good job of killing weeds at his place.  My back yard, here in Texas, is all Bermuda and is strong and thick.  However, there is one area in which an infestation of some kind of a small-leaf clover has begun to grow enough so that it looks poised to crowd out the grass.  My experience with weed killers that claimed not to damage grass has not been good, so I did not hold out great expectations for this one.  To my surprise, though, it has done a very good job of killing most of the clover as well as a few other assorted weeds.  There is still a bit of clover left which does not (fortunately) look healthy, so I will be making a second application.  Some of the grass did lose a bit of its nice green in favor of a more yellow tone, but it was a small amount of grass and it seems to be coming back nicely.  Even though I plan a second application, it has done what it said it would.Two small chinks in the Score:  First, the hose connects to the bottle and when the water is turned on, it pulls the weed killer out into the water stream with it.  My beef with this arrangement is that there is no adjustment on the amount of product that is sprayed.  It would be nice if some adjustment mechanism was provided.  Second, i that I accidentally sprayed a little on the end of a Boxwood hedge and it almost immediately (as in the next day) turned some of the leaves brown.  It did not occur to me that it would consider Boxwood to be a weed.  My fault, but a warning on the label would be nice.  As with all weed killers, though, it did not cover near as much area as it claimed, that being 5,000 sq fr.  I got probably 1,500 square feet from 2 bottles.  If there was an adjustment on the bottle, I could have varied it, of course.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2023
review_content: I have been using this product for years and it has never failed me. Just make sure you apply it correctly. Most folks who have issues likely did not do so. The only reason I knocked it down to a four-star rating is because the directions are extremely hard to find and in such small print that a 60-year-old person like me might have trouble reading them.With that said, what has worked for me is:1) Apply the chemical when the weeds are not cut. Do not mow just before application. Let them leaf out.2) Wait at least an hour after application before watering but preferably wait 24-hours to let the product completely dry.3) Don't mow for at least 48-hours after application.You do these three things and it should work for you too. Don't expect it to completely get rid of weeds forever. You will have to repeat this during the next growing season.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2023
review_content: I previously gave this product a 1 star review as it did not work on Crabgrass. I decided to give it another shot a few weeks later, but changed the manor in which I applied it. This time I turned off my irrigation system TWO days before I applied the product and waited TWO additional days after I applied to turn it back on. That seemed to allow the Crabgrass to 'soak up' the chemical and also not to wash it away so it could be as effective as possible. Reading the instructions it says it only needs one hour to be effective, which I found to be completely false. If you want this product to work as it should, follow my method above and it will work great.

Tip: If your wand outer plastic is cracked you can tape it as shown in (p4) and it works fine.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
review_content: Alright, buckle up, folks.I recently decided to take matters into my own hands and vanquish the unruly weeds in my lawn, so naturally, I turned to the mysterious world of online reviews for guidance. Now, let me tell you about my thrilling adventure with a certain weed killer that has left me scratching my head.I stumbled upon this product that seemed to be the holy grail of weed annihilation - the Ortho WeedClear Lawn Weed Killer Concentrate. Intrigued and hopeful, I eagerly followed the instructions with the precision of a bomb defusal expert. I mean, who wouldn't want a pristine, weed-free lawn, right?But oh boy, reality hit harder than a brick to the face. I unleashed the Ortho WeedClear on my unsuspecting weeds, not once, not twice, but multiple times. And you know what? The weeds stood there, defiant, like they were auditioning for a role in a botanical action movie. I'm starting to think the people who wrote those glowing reviews were either high on some mystical herb or had a garden of plastic plants.I've dabbled in the dark arts of weed-killing before, and let me tell you, this Ortho concoction is like bringing a water gun to a flamethrower fight. While other weed killers flex their muscles and obliterate those pesky invaders within days, Ortho WeedClear just sat there twiddling its thumbs. It's been over a week, and I'm still waiting for the magical moment when my lawn transforms into a weed-free utopia. Spoiler alert: It hasn't happened.I can't help but feel like I've been bamboozled by a snake oil salesman in gardening gloves. Maybe there's some secret ingredient missing from the formula, like unicorn tears or the essence of a vengeful gardener's spirit. Who knows?In conclusion, if you're looking for a weed killer that's more effective than a sternly worded letter to your lawn, I'd suggest looking elsewhere. Ortho WeedClear might be the hero in someone else's garden, but in mine, it's just a silent spectator in the ongoing battle against the green invaders. Save your money, folks, and invest in something that packs a punch.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2020
review_content: I used this product on my lawn after mowing it with a four or five day stretch of dry weather forecast in the mid-late spring.  I am trying to reclaim my lawn after having gone organic the last few years and losing the lawn to weeds.  As usual, there were tons of weeds, I don't know the names of them, especially where I had planted new grass seed last fall.  I mixed with water as directed and sprayed my entire lawn making sure the leaves were covered.  This is a contact killer, not something that works through the soil.  It took several weeks but the clover was reduced by I'd say 75%, most other weeds died off and some other more sturdy broadleaf weeds weren't killed but were definitely supressed so I think one more application will get rid of them.  None of my grass was killed even though it was covered in it.  I kept my dog off the lawn until it was dry and didn't notice a second head growing out of her neck so I think it's fairly safe to use as directed.  I get the feeling that there is no need to over concentrate this stuff in the mix.  The directed amount worked great.

review_content: This product is a weed killer that is engineered to kill many, many varieties of weeds without harming grasses. the instructions are quite clear when it comes to the dangers present in application and the care that needs to be taken to avoid getting product on your person .HOWEVER , it is a complete disaster when it comes to dispensing product per the instructions . once my garden hose was attached and the water turned on the container began leaking and spraying product all over me , my clothes , glasses. etc. the threaded plastic fitting you attach hose to was leaking at the seems and the product was getting on me - not what this sprayer and its product are designed to do .Awful result , poor design in sprayer bottle , and again , a product that comes with severe warnings about the danger to humans and pets in case of skin contact . review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2021
review_content: This stuff is fantastic. I re-seeded my lawn this spring after construction ruined it this past fall, so I didn‚Äôt have a chance to put a pre-emergent down like I usually do. I had clover and miscellaneous weeds pop up all over the place and some crabgrass started to come through as well as the weather got warmer. One hit with this stuff took care of almost all of it and I spot treated the rest with another product. Just use it as directed and make sure you are patient, it DOES NOT work overnight or within a few days regardless of what the label says! It took nearly 2 weeks for the weeds I sprayed to start showing signs of shriveling/browning, but they all died. It took time, but it worked great. A few weeks and a few mows later, my yard is completely weed free. Would highly recommend WeedClear.

review_content: This stuff kills crabgrass DEAD when applied properly. You need a few days of NO RAIN. Hot, sunny summer days are ideal. 90 plus degrees is wonderful. Then your lawn will creep back over the burned areas, or you can add some seed. I use Zoysia plugs that I bought here on Amazon, and it is filling in. Between the two, the crabgrass will be gone.  The negative reviews are BS. The stuff is a heavy killer of ugly, spreading crabgrass.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2023
review_content: Context: You could lose yourself in trying to find "the best" weed killer. My dad stumbled onto this stuff a few years ago. He always had a "custom" mixture. It's a learning curve to find the right mixture. Read below:Pros:- Product is effective at killing everything, most of the time, besides the grass. Spray all over, and you're grass will be fine.- Price- Different volumes available for your yard size.Cons:- Experimenting: reading the manual wasn't only overly-complicated, but the recommended amount was far, far too weak. I calculated things multiple times based on yard size and recommendations in the manual. For this chemical to effectively kill clover, or anything other than thistle, I found that I had to increase the potency by a factor of nearly 2. I ramped it up over 3 separate uses and finally got to a lethal dose.- Not sure it's a con exactly, but to make this stuff is much more effective when adding three drops of Dawn Dish Soap. It visually appears to thicken up the solution a bit more to stick to the leaves on the clover, thistle, and whatever else you're trying to burn up.Overall:If I were to buy again, I'd get a the largest volume available seeing as I'm going to use more than I expected. As for the selective nature of killing only "pest plants", this stuff is really great. No worries of overspray destroying any other stuff around. My hostas, sedums, lillies, and others seem unharmed.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
review_content: it is very effective stuff for winter months.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2022
review_content: This was purchased to declare war on creepy Charlie. Indeed I do declare it kills ground ivy. I did dispense this product in the beginning of July, not the best time. The directions are not the best regarding mixing. I found better directions here in reviews. I did add a sticker and another product that kills creepy Charlie. I expected some browning. This product mixed with others won the war. Charlie is toast. I will wash the product out now and overseed. Right now my lawn looks like a napalm training ground however the ground ivy is gone. I am pleased with this product I would recommend proper mixing and reading directions. This is the real deal not for inexperienced..

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020
review_content: I still give this 5 stars despite the sprayer. The herbicide seems to be effective. I sprayed my lawn with it, and while it didn't kill all the weeds, it knocked out most of them. Before I started, my yard and my neighbors were covered in common mallow and other broad leaf weeds. After about 6 weeks the weeds are coming back, but nowhere near like before. There is a visible line between my yard and my neighbors now where his yard is still mostly common mallow and mine is mostly grass.I am trying a second spraying even though it is now late Spring. Hopefully that will help. If I still have weeds in the fall, I will spray then, which is when you are really supposed to apply this stuff. My main problem with this was the sprayer. I couldn't tell if it was spraying. The level inside the bottle didn't seem to go down. I sprayed the yard for a VERY LONG time and it dropped down finally to about 3 ounces left. That was the first spraying. So this week I decided to put the last three ounces on the lawn. I sprayed the yard thoroughly ... twice. When I finished, the fluid in the level had dropped from 3 ounces to almost 6 ounces. Yes. That is right. IT WENT UP. So something was wrong with the dispenser. I have a big year so originally had two bottles. I had the same problem with both bottles.So, if you have a dispenser already, I recommend buying the herbicide separately and using your own sprayer.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
review_content: This product does, in fact, kill unwanted weeds while leaving the good grass in place.I'm in Dallas, Texas and I've got a pretty nice 50/50 Bermuda/St. Augustine lawn, with crab grass, chick weed, some stuff that looks like a green lace doily, dallis grass, yadda, yadda.I sprayed each type and as the label says, results were pretty quick in coming.  I liked it so much I got another bottle.  Weeds will show curling and browning by the next day, dying altogether in 4 days.If you've got a little arthritis in your thumbs, the manual spray bottle will give them a workout, but I didn't want to invest in a gallon of the concentrate before I knew what it'd do.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2023
review_content: I use this product for the early spring weed Poa Ana and then in middle-late summer when Spurge starts growing. Kills them all with 1 spraying (1 1/2 oz to 1 gallon water). Kills other weeds as well but unsure of name. Great product.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2017
review_content: Update 6/5/22: I have almost given up on this, but I figured out how to use it most effectively. Wait until the weeds, and in my case the Creeping Charly ground ivy is at its peak in the season. When the weeds are really at their peak, use this and be sure the wait 3 days after cutting your grass and leave it sit 2 days before cutting again. Give the grass a good soaking with it and let it do its work. Also read the instructions on temperatures. If it is too cold or too hot outside, this will not work correctly.After this application, I could see it working. It takes about three good days and you see the weeds and Creeping Charly start to die off. It takes about 2 weeks to see the effect. We now have grass. Here is my tip on the best way to use Weed Free Zone.Apply as I wrote above, but in late summer. That is very important. Then in fall re-seed your lawn with a good quality grass seed and fertilzer. Come spring, the weeds are gone, very thick grass takes over and my lawn now looks great. Repeat this process every year and you get a lawn that looks like you have a lawn care service doing it at a much lower cost. I am sticking with my issue on the sprayer. After spraying about 3/4 of the bottle, the Weed Free Zone get thick and milky, clogs the sprayer and doesn't work right anymore.I bought two more bottles for this coming fall to keep the weeds at bay. I will re-seed again and enjoy a great looking lawn next year again. I feel embarrased about the 1 star rating earlier due to my misuse of the product. Read, do it right, and it works wonders. 4 stars from us now. I took one star off for the clogging of the sprayer.Original review: didn't work as I expected. The sprayer doesn't work at all. Had to buy a sprayer to get the product on my lawn. Creeping Charlie still thriving. Crab Grass wasn't affected.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2015
review_content: After reading some of the reviews, I wasn't sure if this stuff would work.  If I remember correctly, some said we should be doing this in the fall and not spring.  Well, I am not going to wait and let this creeping charlie expand even more than it is now.Got the bottle and went out that day to start applying it. (March 3, 2015)  We have a very large yard and I can't tell you how much creeping charlie is all over it.  Since we just moved in last July, I really didn't have a chance to scope out the grass.  Grass turned brown over the winter and with spring here I started noticing green splotches of creeping charlie.  I know how tough this stuff is to get control of so I wanted to get on it right away.First day we only sprayed about 1/2 of the back yard.  Sure enough it rained the next day!  Went out today to start again when I noticed all that I sprayed 5 days earlier was either wilted or completely dead.  I am more than thrilled!  Thought for sure the rain ruined the application effectiveness.It's hard to walk over an acre of grass and see every single bit of the creeping charlie.  But got as much as we could with this spray today.Now we will just have to wait a week and see if we got the majority of this stubborn weed.  As long as the grass doesn't turn green, I'll be able to spot the weeds I missed on the first 2 passes.  I will definitely recommend this product for anyone looking for something to control their creeping charlie issues.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2021
review_content: I'm in zone 6 and have tall fescue in the middle of a rural area in a forest and next to an unmanaged pasture with every weed imaginable. Year after year tried various other products without success. This product killed the weeds the other products could not.I made 1 application then 2 weeks later made my second application. (I just read you should wait for 30 days before making 2nd application. Ooops.) After the first application, one week later the weeds were mostly dead and the undesirable grasses were yellowing. A few days after the 2nd application the undesirable grasses are definitely checking out.My 1st application rate was 1.5oz per gallon sprayed out of tank sprayer on a 4-wheeler. The 2nd application (also 1.5oz/gal) was made with a 2 gallon sprayer (about 7 gallons total) because most the weeds were dead so I had much less area to cover.My grass has never ever looked so good!!!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2021
review_content: On the plus side, it kills the ground ivy without damaging many other plants in my lawn, which is what I was looking for. I found it worked best mixed at a little bit stronger concentration than per the instructions, and in many areas required more than one spraying, but in the end is effective. I was surprised it did not kill the violets in my lawn, which was fine with me since I like violets. It even killed bind weed. The smell will drift across the yard for days, especially with light breeze and humid nights.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2015
review_content: I purchased this product to deal with clover that has been overtaking our yard.  This was the first time using the product so we applied it to fully mature plants in the middle of summer.  It took two applications, as indicated in the instructions, but I am now seeing results.  I also am happy to report that the grass did not appear to be harmed.  Their are cautions on the container to not apply to your lawn during times of stress, such as drought or high heat.  I would recommend this product to others.  Next spring I intend to get a head start on the problem and apply this to clover patches early, as recommended, before they have the chance to mature and develop a strong foothold.  Four stars for now.  I will try to remember to follow up next summer and if things go well I may adjust it to five stars.

review_content: I live in Oklahoma and had a terrible weed problem. All my neighbors were paying upwards of 150 bucks to have the local landscape guy spray. I treated my front and back yard and it worked wonders. My front yard was so bad that a 2nd application killed off any pesky weeds that didn't die the first round. Now my lawn is just as beautiful as my neighbors and I didn't spend nearly an 1/8th of what they did! I HIGHLY recommend this stuff.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2018

review_content: I live in VA where we get a lot of hot and humid weather, and weeds grow like crazy. review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2021
review_content: Preen is absolutely amazing. You must follow application instructions and it's important to apply when it tells you to (i.e. before crabgrass emerges, not after it emerges). I live in New Jersey. Every Spring, my lawn is practically free of clover and crabgrass after the first application. I have used Preen for about 4 years now and will never go back to that worthless SCOTTs product which only nourishes the weeds and crabgrass. After I use Preen Crabgrass Control in early spring, I maintain lawn with another feeding of Preen All in One around late August. June and July the grass is drying up with the harsh heat and sun, so i don't waste Preen when the grass is going dormant. With Preen, you don't need the 4 different applications that SCOTTs makes you do. So worth it. Definitely recommend Preen products.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2020
review_content: Behind our house is about a 50‚Äô drainage right of way.  It is maintained by the HOA, but all they do is cut the grass and weeds.  They do nothing to kill/prevent weeds.  So, I have a challenge each year with keeping the unwanted grass and weeds out of my lawn.The Preen Crabgrass Control is a preventive treatment.  That is, you apply it prior to seeing any crabgrass in your lawn.  It is designed to keep it from even getting a start.First, a disclaimer.  It is not possible to prove a negative ‚Äì that is, you can observe that there is no crabgrass but you cannot prove why.  Since I treated my yard, it is not possible to say how bad things might have been.  I did not split test my lawn.I have not seen any evidence of crabgrass in the lawn this year.  It apparently is doing what it is designed to do.I use a spreader and set it according to the instruction on the package.  The Preen pellets were easy to apply, they go on evenly and covered the entire lawn.I‚Äôm pleased with the ease of application and the results.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2020
review_content: I love the fact that the Preen Lawn Crabgrass Control doesn‚Äôt just kill weeds, but also prevents them. That‚Äôs saves us a lot of muscle power in the future. Plus, application is easy and fast.Considering, though, that we own one acre of land, it is expensive to keep our lawn looking pretty. In essence, we require 10 bags of Preen Lawn Crabgrass Control, because one bag covers 5,000 square feet, and we need a total of nearly 50,000 square feet of this product to cover our entire lawn.That being said, for us a nice-looking environment is worth the cost and effort, and this product will help us keep up appearances.Thank you for taking the time to read my review, and if you find it Helpful, please click the ‚ÄúHelpful‚Äù button below. I receive no compensation, but work extra hard to help shoppers make the right decisions with their shopping needs. I appreciate your support and thank you in advance.üòòüòò

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2020
review_content: Now that grass is finally starting to grow, I have noticed a SIGNIFICANT reduction in the amount of crabgrass in my yard when compared to last Spring.  I spread this Preen Crabgrass Control in the early Spring when I first started noticing growth.  It was easy to apply and went a long way.  I nearly forgot about the application until I noticed that there was almost no crabgrass growing in the yard.  Last year it seemed like crabgrass was overtaking our yard.  This was my first use of this product.  So far, I am a big fan!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2020
review_content: There are two main things that I really like about this product:(1) it‚Äôs not mixed with fertilizer.  I like to purchase fertilizer separately, so I can buy the right kind that my lawn needs‚Äînot whatever happens to come in the package with the crabgrass preventer.  All fertilizers are not the same.  It‚Äôs pretty hard to find crabgrass control that is not mixed with something else, so I appreciate this product.(2) Although this is a pre-emergent crabgrass killer (which means its a preventer that stops crabgrass from germinating before you see it in your lawn‚Äîapply it late winter/early spring before it gets warm enough for last year‚Äôs seeds to germinate which is around 50-55 degrees), it also works if you are a little late in spring because it also works on EARLY post-emergent crabgrass (that means if you start to see some in your lawn early in the spring, this will still work to kill that early crabgrass too).This is not the product to apply in June after your crabgrass is well established.  For that you would need a post-emergent crabgrass killer.This is a good product for preventing crabgrass and controlling it very early in spring. I do recommend it.If my review was helpful, please let Amazon know by clicking ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù.  Thanks.

review_content: I applied this pretty early - in March.  It has kept crabgrass from taking hold, but I couldn't really comment on killing any active spots. I do like that when it says it treats 5,000 square feet, that's at the full strength needed to both prevent and kill. review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
review_content: I love this product. It is the only pre-emergent that I use at my farm in the areas used by kids and pets and also for my vegetables box. It is very effective but timing and replication is critical for success. In my case I bought it to control annual foxtail (hare barley) and this weed germinate in FALL so I have to apply this product mid August and then again mid September and I almost eradicate this weed at my farm already in only seasons. So check when the weed you want to control germinates and calculate about 4 weeks of this product to be fully effective as a pre-emergent. If your weed germinate in spring then I would apply this product early mid April or as soon as the soil temperature is 50F and then again 4 weeks later. No more harmful chemicals! It is 100% made with corn.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2012
review_content: I have bought this product from our local garden centers in the past.  I don't have any problem with the performance of this product.  Just be sure that you remove all weeds AND their roots before applying the product.  It only hinders germination, it doesn't kill weeds or stop them from growing up from roots or root pieces.I'm now trying to grow my veggies organically, though, so I no longer use this product for my edible plants.  I really wish there would be more legislation on the use of the term "organic."  This product is 100% corn gluten, and since corn is organic (meaning from a living thing as opposed to inorganic rocks, minerals, or man-made chemicals), this is an "organic" product.  While I love the fact that they're not manufactured chemicals, you're still going to be adding any of the pesticides or herbicides that the farmer used to grow the corn when you buy this product.  The company has no requirement that the corn be grown organically, so you can be assured of a nice variety of chemicals mixed in with your "organic" product.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2021
review_content: I've been using Preen for over five years now.  I spread it out over my gravel yard that has weed block sheets underneath.  It does a great job on preventing new weeds.  I have an electrical dispenser which makes it very easy to spread the gluten on the yard.  The dispenser that comes with the "jar" works very well and dispenses the gluten, which is small granular bits effectively, but tends to have "clumps" of gluten as I shake it from side-to-side.  I usually spread the gluten so that there's about 15 particles per square inch.  My wife has had cancer, so this is the only natural solution that we've found.  Since the verdict on R****d-U* appears to be a cause of concern.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020
review_content: Follow the directions carefully.  I loved my St Augustine lawn but abused our relationship.  The weeds were getting a bit out of hand in a couple of areas but the usually die out in the summer heat.  But, this April, I felt ashamed my lawn lost her beauty and she was just ragged looking.  You see, I live in Southern CA and St Augustine which is not the norm.  But, I also have two big dogs, and they can be tough on the traditional fescue.  So, I knew enough that you can‚Äôt use a regular herbicide and none of the big box stores stocked anything appropriate.  So, I saw this ‚Äòsafe for St Augustine‚Äô solution here on Amazon.  Simple, connect to hose and spray, right...  oh, so wrong I was.I sprayed my lawn the day I received it and 5 days later, the weeds seemed to laugh.  Yes, some of the weaker souls perished, but, must we‚Äôre laughing. I was not amused, but, remembered reading how the reviews implied it was gutless.  So, not being undaunted, I chose to give it a go one more time..  Don‚Äôt do this.  Be patient.  Within 3 days of the 2nd spraying, my lawn was dying and within a month it was dead. Tomorrow, the new sod arrives.  So, if you want to avoid a huge expense, READ DIRECTIONS...I‚Äôm giving 3 stars because it definitely has the power to kill...  I blame the user for its failure.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2016
review_content: So I just spoke to a rep at Bayer over the phone who was clearly reading the "My fault" responses that popped up on her screen. They are offering me a refund of 8 dollars because I,in their words, over broadcast their "safe for St Augustine" weed killer hose spray.The problem here is "Over-broadcasting"...... If you buy and use this product there is no way that you cannot over broadcast this. You hook up the hose and half the bottle dumps out in 3 minutes. Do the math-You would have to be spraying this over 16,000 sq. ft and literally running around your property at a very fast pace. This idea is ridiculous. Even more ridiculous is the bottle misleads you by stating " treats up to 16,000 sqft" Up to? Well they really hold the belief that it should be all 16,000 sqft.! if you use this on 15,500 sqft you just misused their product, your fault! ... I simply sprayed this over a large lawn area with no overlapping involved and because there is no regulation of the flow rate from the bottle, NONE! It jets out and empties the bottle very quickly.... "in the eyes of Bayer" I have misused their wonderful safe for St.Augustine product. I was told several times to "always read the directions" as if I am some idiot who just got into lawn care. Bayer should have stepped up and admitted their defective delivery system.Most importantly I followed all directions- 4 days of low temps, Regular St Augustine (not Floratam) , no overlapping areas etc. and now over 60% of my previously healthy lawn is dead. This will also happen to you if you use this- make sure you read other reviews from around the web. This is a very poor product and it will kill your lawn and there is nothing that Bayer will do for you except make you feel at fault and condescendingly refund the 8 bucks that killed your healthy grass.Yeah thanks alot for the offer but what about my lawn?Now I am left with a decision on either to re-sod or try to somehow save the little remaining grass I have left. Please be advised that Bayer will not do anything for you, they take no responsibility and systematically set you up with a series of questions to find a fault so they are not left liable. you are much better off mixing and using your own sprayer to treat your lawn or paying a service to do it for you. From here out I will never buy another Bayer product not even an aspirin. This product should be removed from the shelves and a recall/class action suit should follow. I cannot express to those of you sitting in the store holding this product in your hand and considering the purchase, hopefully you are reading the reviews that I failed to read before I used this blue bottle of poison. DO NOT EVEN THINK ABOUT TAKING A CHANCE WITH THIS JUNK! Your grass will die and your neighbors will laugh at you!Cons: Not Durable, poison for grass, misleading labels, poor qc, poor company support, high fail rate, kills healthy grass

review_content: One fine day as I was admiring the emerald beauty of my front lawn, I noticed a small patch of dollar weeds.  The horror!!!! review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2013
review_content: As per Bayer, this product is not effective below 50 degreesF nor is it effective full strength.I applied this product twice, once at 32oz at 42 degreesF on 900sq feet of bermuda lawn, weeds multiplied the next three weeks. I applied a second 32oz of this product mixed in a 5-gallon sprayer on two hundred SF of lawn. I then applied this product at full strength directly on Henbit and dandelion weeds to no effect after 10 days. I paid $16.00 for each of these 32oz bottles but was told by Bayer they would refund the national average price of $7.00 per bottle.I purchased one bottle of IMAGE and applied to 900 sf of lawn, most weeds were yellow to dead in 4 days.Bayer suggest the season long all purpose weed killer.

review_content: Tried it  it is like Spraying water on your weeds. Waited 10 days for Kill then called Bayer they said for Clover it may take 2 weeks to 28 days to kill. Wait 2 weeks and then respray. Still after 2 weeks it doesn't keill weeds.Bayer would only refund 1 container of spray not two.  Won't buy this again.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2019
review_content: Works great on weeds and also crabgrass when used according to directions

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2018
review_content: OK...I've used this twice now and it works well.  The first time I used this it did not work at all, that was totally my fault.  At the top of this bottle is a trigger that you need to push forward, when you do water streams out.  What I didn't realize is that the first detent is water only.  When you push it farther forward then it sucks the weed killer up.  So I have proven now that water does not kill weeds.  Once I did this correctly, the Chickweed was turning color by the next morning.  Now I've read that some people really soak the area.  I wouldn't and that's not what the instructions say.  This kills by landing on the leaves and soaking in.  It doesn't go up through the root system.  It doesn't kill the grass...but it is hard on it.  That's why I'd be careful as to how much you lay down on your healthy grass.  Kill the weed not the lawn.  I've included a picture of 3 days after I applied this. The top corner is new SOD. The poison did touch that aread and you can see it's ok. I didn't soak it, but it got sprayed.  It's dying everywhere on my lawn.  I'm guessing after it's done I'll overseed and fertilize to get things back to normal.  But my guess to the reviews that say this doesn't work, they probably didn't push the trigger fully forward.  Because I don't see how I could have 100% success and then someone else would have none.  This was very quick acting once I sorted the trigger out.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
review_content: I read so many reviews of different products before buying this one.  I had extensive Creeping Charlie in my yard, and I was very concerned about how to get rid of it given how hard it sounds to eliminate.  Fortunately, this did the trick.  For me, I had to apply it three times over the course of three weeks.  I doubled the dose recommended in my sprayer and then sprayed it once per week.  Lo and behold, all the Creeping Charlie has withered and died over a month of time using this method.  I still have half the bottle left over as well.  This stuff is great!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2018
review_content: I never liked Ortho products as i bought multiple weed killers before from them and they never worked.I then was always against using their products and stuck to other weed products. Well i had an infestation of wild violet and clover covering my septic mound in the back of my yard. I used multiple products and nothing seemed to get rid of the problem. I've saw multiple Youtubers using this product claiming it got rid of wild violet and thought why not and try their products again. My first purchase was from my local store and i ended up spraying it down at night a couple months ago. I came back the next day to find the leaves were starting to slowly die and it seemed to be doing it's job. fast forward a week and it killed most of my wild violet along with burning small parts of my lawn which it claims it doesn't. I sprayed this product under 80 degrees so i didn't understand but it was no big deal for me. I would say that Ortho B gon got rid of about 85-90% of the wild violet and clover on my septic mound with the first spray. I waited 2 months and then today 8/10/18 i applied it again to finally get rid of the rest. It seemed to be the same product you can buy from a local hardware store, but the handle was different but i mean if it gets the job done then who cares. WRONG. I connected the hose, turned the water on and it started leaking from the connection. I tightened it a bit more and it stopped leaking for a bit. Well as i moved around my yard spraying, every time the hose moved at the connection it started leaking. Now don't get me wrong the product works wonders but this stuff was leaking all over me the entire time. Now i was applying this product heavily to the spots with wild violet so i didn't mind if it leaked, but if you need an exact amount then i wouldn't recommend this over just buying it locally. I knew it was leaking the product along with the water because you could smell it. I'm not sure if it was just this bottle that was leaking or if they all do that. Besides the leaking i would highly recommend this product  to kill the violet and clover. I provided some pictures of the small amount i have left, what my septic mound looks like now after spraying this product 2 months ago and what the rest of my lawn looks like currently.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
review_content: Not being the most patient woman in the world, upon spraying this, and then watching for the next few days, I was frustrated at the lack of perceived progress in killing the oxalis. I expected it to be similar to Roundup which kills quickly, but this is more of an ‚Äòendurance‚Äô product.I finally got on the website and looked up reviews on what people found worked best (or what they experienced). Yes, it took two courses of spray every two weeks to eradicate the oxalis. I made sure I watered the night before and made sure I hadn‚Äôt mowed three days prior to application (or three days after). It didn‚Äôt burn or otherwise have any affect on the grass itself.The oxalis patches I had in my lawn are now crispy critters that are disintegrating into nothingness.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
review_content: I have a terrible creeping Charlie problem, which I have treated before.  This year I went to war.  So here is my experience with this product.  I like this concentrate in the container so you can mix your own ratios and spray with the sprayer of your choice or swab unlike the hose sprayer containers at the big box store.  If you follow the instructions, I believe mine said 3-6ounces per gallon of water to treat yada yada 1-2000 sq ft. It will weaken the creeping charlie and in some cases kill it, good thing being it will not hurt your grass. (Best going into fall)  Ok some control, but I want it gone!  I tried about 9 ounces of product with 1/2 gallon.  Worked better, but it will kill grass at this level.  If you have an accurate tip for your sprayer you can mitigate the damage to your lawn.  Swabbing full strength works best, everything you coat will die (I used a 1" paint Brush).  Very tedious and time consuming to swab especially depending on how much you have and the size of your yard.  At least with the concentrate I can do that.  In retrospect, I should have used some kind of dye in my sprayer because I was dealing with a large area and even though I was methodical in my application, there were some areas I missed.  So if it is your first time with this product and you have a large area to treat, you could start with the recommended label instructions, just be prepared that you may have to retreat after a week or two.  They will usually turn yellow, crinkle and die in 2-5 days.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2021
review_content: This worked great for me (northeast US)!  My yard had been taken over by large patches of thick white CLOVER.  I tried pulling it out.  I saw I wasn't going to be able to do it.  Then I remembered something in a green bottle that I used about 15 years ago, and sure enough it was an Ortho product specifically for CLOVER.  So I ordered this one and sprayed it only on the patches of clover back on April 5 and watched it to see.  I was skeptical.  It just looked like water on the clover plants.  But six days later the clover was turning yellow.  So, two weeks after the first application I sprayed it again, just to make sure the product was zapping it.  Gradually, the clover not only turned yellow but also shriveled up among the remaining grass.  And now, six weeks after the initial application, I can't see ANY TRACE of the clover that I sprayed.  No trace whatsoever.  But several small patches of clover have popped up in nearby areas that I didn't spray, so I sprayed those today.  So, THE PRODUCT WORKS.  It's not instant gratification, though.  It does take awhile.  Now here is the one thing YOU NEED TO KNOW.  When clover grows in your grass, it crowds out the grass so that there's less grass that can grow there.  And when the clover is removed, well, there's less grass there.  I think this is why some people are saying it killed their grass.  It was the CLOVER that crowded out the grass.  The spray does not kill grass.  The remedy for thin grass or small bare spots where the clover crowded out the grass is to spot treat the areas and plant more grass seed.  If the spots are small enough, the existing grass will grow into it, now that the clover is gone.  I'm really glad I bought this and was able to get rid of the large patches of clover!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
review_content: This product will NOT kill clover.  It barely does damage to Violets with a single application (spot spray).  This product wouldn't kill anything if applied as a blanket spray of the lawn and at intervals per labeling.The clover's waxy leaves don't allow for even coverage on the leaves, as required for a product like this to work.  Even adding an additional surfactant to the mix, e.g. baby shampoo (thanks Allyn the Lawn Care Nut on YT) Doesn't help to relieve the surface tension on the clover leaf.It has one of two ingredients that are effective on the labeled weeds, so it should get some results better than what it is done.  Perhaps the formula is too weak.  However, even mixing the product at a higher rate than labeled, should do more damage to the weeds than it does, so I'm not sure what the problem is in total.It works fine on Chickweed but that's an easy one to kill anyway.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2021
review_content: My lawn had a terrible clover problem.  Nothing I tried seemed to work.  I read reviews from many people that seemed to indicate that this killed clover.  But some reviewers said it didn't.  I decided to try it, knowing that I could return it to Amazon, if it didn't work.  I followed the instructions carefully and made sure to spray near sunset, so that the sun could not bake the solution and so that the leaves were cool. I added a surfactant to the water in my sprayer.  THIS WAS THE KEY.  By adding the surfactant, the Ortho Weed B Gon stayed attached to the clover leaves.  By the next morning, all of the plants were white and withering.  By day 3, they were almost gone.  By the end of the week, better than 90% were gone.  I made a second application and eliminated them all.  This was the first time I had this kind of success in 10 years of clover infestation.  If they start to appear again, I'll just follow the same procedure.  I HIGHLY recommend this product.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2018
review_content: I live on Cape Cod and clover is common on lawns here.  This product was super easy to attach to the hose and to apply to the sections of lawn where I had clover taking over.  Within two weeks the clover was greatly diminished.  One week later it started to make comeback, so I blasted it again.  After two applications it is completely wiped out.  It hasn't been so successful against ground ivy, "creeping charlie",  in the grass.  I have hit it several times and it's not going anywhere.  Other reviewers mentioned needing a second application too, so factor that into your square footage when you shop.  I ended up buying a second bottle to make sure I could get a full second application.  One last thought:  I don't know how long the bottle will last.  The level of material in the bottle does go down, but for some time, it has remained about two inches from the bottom.  I wonder if it is so mixed with water from the hose, that it is no longer effective.  I don't want to throw out a bottle with one-fifth liquid in it, but I don't know if that liquid is weed-b-gone, or just water.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2021
review_content: I've used Ortho Weed B Gon (and Bug B Gon) products in the past with great results. However, I found something in my yard that just wouldn't die off. After a bit of research I found that it was Oxalis stricta (aka: common yellow oxalis). Then I came across the "Ortho Weed B Gon Chickweed, Clover & Oxalis Killer for Lawns". I picked up two bottles and ended up using about one and a half bottles over about 7,000sq ft of yard area. Let me just tell you this... I was shocked how much grass I did NOT have... ugh!! But that was the goal... to kill off everything that wasn't healthy grass, I have tall fescue. Currently its been about 12 days since I sprayed the yard and about 10 since I dethatched and reseeded. Currently the new grass is coming is great, about 1 inch tall today. The Ortho did not hinder the reseeding of the new grass nor the continued growth of the established fescue.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2023

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2014
review_content: Oxalis in my new Korean grass was IMPOSSIBLE to get rid of........yes, I knew that maybe, probably, once it grew super thick that it would eventually kill of the oxalis but it was EVERYWHERE and spreading.  I tried everything that the local Home Depot had - no luck - and everything that sounded plausible from the gardening sites on the Internet.  Finally came to this product(not at the local Home Depot??  Wonder why) and called the 800 number to see if it would let my Korean grass live and kill the oxalis....they said it was one of the specific grasses that this worked on.  I tried the strength that they recommend in a garden hand sprayer and it didn't really do much, but I read on some of the other reviews that you should double the strength.  You have to make sure that you don't water for a couple of days after spraying, but once I doubled the strength it killed 90% of the oxalis in a few days.  Shriveled up and I didn't even have to pull up the dead stuff.  I am absolutely dead amazed at how well this worked, and on the second application the oxalis was gone for good - just don't get this on your other plants or it will kill them, so be careful.  This stuff works as advertised, and I'm so thankful that I found it.  Don't know about any of the other grasses that it says it works on, but if you have Korean grass and oxalis making you crazy you will thank them and me if you use it.  Good luck and good gardening!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2014
review_content: I guess if you're reading this review, you may have been like me ...  In that you have a nice lawn being invaded by clovers or that dreaded Oxalis weed.  And you're probably wondering the same two things....  First, does it work and second, will it kill my grass.  Well, from my observations, the answer to the first question is yes, but for Oxalis, it may take a couple treatments.  I noticed that it has definitely affected the Oxalis, but because it's such an evasive, strong weed, it's leaves turned brown but the roots seem like they're still unaffected.  I'm hoping its early yet and the leaves are an early sign that it will eventually die.  But for sure, this particular variant of Scott's Weed-B-Gone has been formulated to systemically affect Oxalis.  I'll try to remember to update this review at a layer point in time, but even though my Oxalis doesn't appear to be "dead-dead", I'm satisfied that I found something that addresses it.As for the regular grass...  Well....  Good news!  So far at least, my regular grass seems unaffected.  And it remains so after a good drenching of Weed-B-Gone with a garden hose attachable sprayer.  So this made me even more pleased.The product seems to work as advertised, and even if it takes awhile to kill the Oxalis (or simply halts it's advancement) I'm happy.  Because at least I have something in my arsenal that affects Oxalis specifically and will not kill my Marathon Lawn...!  :-)

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2017
review_content: This works really well to get rid of chickweed - I actually did two applications about a week apart and I couldn't see a single weed remaining. Did you know that chickweed seeds can lay dormant in your lawn for up to seven years? Fun! The lawn care companies I hired were totally unhelpful of course and actually told me "we can't get rid of the weeds we just reduce them." The arrogance! Had I known it was so easy to get rid of them using this spray then I wouldn't have spent all those hours pulling hundreds of them individually. review_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2021
review_content: I have a little bit of everything in my yard, chickweed, clover, creeping charlie, dandelions etc and decided to give this stuff a try last year. I decided to give this stuff another go given the reviews here - thinking I might have not have sprayed enough on the lawn or maybe something was wrong with my batch. Used it 3 weeks ago and really it's the same effect. Only about 10% of the tough stuff (clover and creeping charlie) seems to have started dying. It didn't do anything on my chickweed. Given others advice, a second treatment seems to be necessary, however, this stuff isn't cheap given you need to do it twice. I might try Bonide's Chickweed, Clover and Oxalis Weed Killer Concentrate next to see if that's any better.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2019
review_content: It took a few more days than I was expecting, but this does indeed kill clovers and left my grass alone.  I did accidentally get it on some of my bushes and those leaves did indeed die off.  But that's my fault and not the products.  I wish they had a version that worked on Bermuda grass! Also, it goes quickly. Have your path planned out so that you aren't trying to decide where to go once you're stuck in your yard work no where to go without backtracking.  I didn't water my lawn like it's recommended to do after you apply this, but it still worked just fine. You can do it a day or a few hours before rain and you'll be just fine.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2023

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020
review_content: Absolutely destroyed the clover in a week.  Hasn't returned in a month now.  Followed the instructions, I think it was ** 1oz/gal/200ft **.  Do not expect this to work if you use less product.  I had to measure my yard and do 200sqft sections.  I used a pump sprayer, seemed like I was putting down a lot of product but it worked amazingly.  Didn't hurt the grass.  Then I let it sit for a few days and the results were amazing.  Don't mow for a few days before or after.Might need a dethatching rake or the groundskeeper rake to pull it out after.  I have to reseed the areas the clover was in as it left the lawn quite thin after.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2019
review_content: If you have any experience with clover or creeping charlies, then you know how fast they can invade and take over your yard. This is the only product I have used (never wanted to try the truly toxic stuff) that has kept the weed at bay.I find it's best to apply this when the weed is first flowering int he spring or just before the fall. But don't be afraid to use it whenever you feel the need, as these weeds can grow very quickly. Spray when you know it is not going to rain for a few days and let it dry on the leaves.You may need to reapply after a week if you do not see they are all dying. My advice is to keep on it. Also, keep away from animals. I like to spay my back yard just before we go on vacation and know our animals will not be exposed to anything harmful.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
review_content: As a dedicated gardener striving for effective weed control, Southern Ag Surfactant for Herbicides has become my essential companion for maximizing the performance of herbicides in my garden.The first thing that stands out is the non-ionic nature of this surfactant. It improves the spreading and sticking properties of herbicides, ensuring better coverage on weed surfaces for more efficient absorption.The 16-ounce size is a standout feature of the Southern Ag Surfactant. It provides ample quantity to last through multiple herbicide applications, making it a cost-effective choice for long-term weed management.One significant advantage of this surfactant is its compatibility with a wide range of herbicides. It can be used with various weed killers, enhancing the effectiveness of each application.The easy-to-use design of the Southern Ag Surfactant is another highlight. It can be conveniently mixed with herbicides, eliminating any complexity in the application process.In conclusion, Southern Ag Surfactant for Herbicides is more than just a surfactant; it's an essential tool for achieving efficient and effective weed control in my garden. With its non-ionic properties, ample quantity, compatibility with different herbicides, and user-friendly design, this surfactant has become a critical component of my gardening arsenal. For gardeners seeking enhanced herbicide performance and superior weed control, Southern Ag Surfactant for Herbicides is a top-notch choice. Tackle weeds with confidence, thanks to Southern Ag Surfactant for Herbicides - Your Essential Companion for Efficient Weed Control!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2022
review_content: I bought this surfactant for spot spraying weeds. There had been some herbicides that failed to work properly so I figured this stuff would help. The attached photos are of some weeds I sprayed to hopefully kill off before winter - nutsedge, poa, dandelions, spurge, etc. That was three days ago. I sprayed in the morning then we had rain all afternoon and I thought it would prove to be a waste of chemicals, but the surfactant seems to be still doing its thing and breaking surface tension after several days, rain, and irrigation! While the herbicides haven't shown results yet, I'm amazed to see that the surfactant is still active. The darker green areas are where my irrigation from this morning is not beading up on the weeds or surrounding grass. When I run out of this bottle, I'm definitely buying more of the same because this stuff just plain works and I can get it at a good price.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2017
review_content: Summary:It‚Äôs cheap, lasts a long time, kills weeds faster, and helps use less chemicals / repeat sprays.After entensive use I‚Äôve figured this out. It‚Äôs amazing and don‚Äôt spray without it. Makes weed killer about 10% more effective. What? Only 10% you say... At the same time, it makes the weed killer work 2x to 3x as fast. By day 3, I can see the weed killer work almost everytime. Normally, it takes 7-10 days before I can see results. In a fast world, this is a life saver. Helps knowing you‚Äôve done right by your lawn. Guessing 7 days later if you have to spray again is not a game you want to be playing and not one your lawn wants to deal with.I would also definitely recommend using the insecticide rates even for herbicides or doubling the herbicide rate of 1-2tspn per gallon. I didnt notice any benefit at a 1-2 teaspoon rate per gallon. I might have a weird water hardness though.On a side note:Much smaller than expected. Not quite sure what I had envisioned a pint looking like. I should‚Äôve gotten the gallon.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2021
review_content: My weed killer won't stick to the leaves of Oxalis in my lawn grass.  The liquid weed killer just rolls off and so it doesn't do it's job.  Added a teaspoon of this stuff to a half gallon of "Oxalis killer"....and viola....sticks to the leaves and in a few days....dead Oxalis!!!I had a lawn service for years when I worked....and one time I asked him why he sprayed the entire lawn...but then walked around spot spraying the Oxalis only with a small pump sprayer....He told me they added something special to the week killer to make it stick to the Oxalis leaves.  Now that I'm retired and doing my own lawn care....this is what I needed.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020
review_content: This product is worth its weight in GOLD! I have a massive field next to my home that I have to maintain. It gets infested with dandelion weeds. They are the scourge of the earth do their their innate ability for mass propagation. Normally when I use Spectraside weed killer, it takes a few days to see full results. Not any more! By using the surfactant, it breaks the surface area of the liquid and allows for even coverage and full penetration onto the weed. I'm not kidding you..... I sprayed the weeds in the afternoon last week. I came out the next morning and the weeds we dead. I'm not talking kinda dead. I'm talking brown, shriveled, scorched to the ground dead. I will never not use a surfactant again. A little bit goes a long way with this product. But if you really want to maximize the effectiveness of the herbaside you're using to kill weeds, DO NOT hesitate to get this. It's a game changer!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2018
review_content: I was researching how to best treat weeds in my yard and decided to give a surfactant a shot. I did one dose with common dish soap (1tbs per gallon) and it was ok but I did not see an appreciable difference and the foam was not helpful. I used this on my dichondra and I immediately saw the area I sprayed looked different. I spread weed control fertilizer a few weeks before, and then used soap in the weed killer and saw almost no impact on the most stubborn weeds. This surfactant let the weed killer stick to the leaves and the areas that I sprayed were noticeably different. Clover and other weeds disappeared within a week. The dichondra is a stubborn weed. I am using a Home Depot brand weed killer for lawns and this worked well without killing my lawn in areas I sprayed. I highly recommend this product and I will never spray for weeds without it again.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2017
review_content: I take pride in protecting my lawn. As a result, I have to mix up various chemicals to kill specific types of weeds. I always add two things at the end of the herbicides to my sprayer - this surfactant and blue dye (Monterey sells MarkIt). The surfactant helps the herbicide stick, and NOT slide, to the leaves of the weeds. This is especially helpful when spraying large batches of poison ivy. Because it sticks, and because the final solution is blue (MarkIt), it is very easy to see where I have sprayed the herbicide mix.I have not run into any instances yet in which I would not use this product. Not much is needed to make your herbicide "soapy" and stick to the plants. While you could use dish soap, it tends to form bubbles in the sprayer tank when you slosh it (to stir up the chemicals) around. I have found this to work much better. You can certainly use dish soap in a pinch.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2016
review_content: Works as advertised.  For comparison, I treated one of our ponds with this surfactant and another with dish soap.  I found that the dish soap, at about 1Tbs per gallon, worked just about as well.  This stuff isn't all that expensive and may have more staying power than dish soap.  I guess as long as it stays cheap, I'd say go ahead and get it. But if you're in a pinch, just use dish soap.For using this as a surfactant outside of the water, I think this is probably much better than dish soap.  You can see it stick to the dry plants.  For applications outside the water, definitely use this over dish soap.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
review_content: i just received this product (07/21/23).  i had to put every single piece together, but all the parts were there, and it took me a little over an hour.  filled up the tank and turned on the pump to check for leaks.  i had to tighten 2 clamps to stop some dripping, but in about 3 seconds i heard a SNAP and the wand handle started spewing water.  i turned off the valve to it, and tried to start using the broadcast sprayer, and it ran ok.  the motor was fine for a few seconds, then just stopped.  the wire connection from the first connector to the motor  is f/u.  the smallest movement causes it to stop.  i taped it down so it couldn't move and it ran ok.i will call their customer service monday a/m and see what they say.  so far, it seems quality control is unimpressive.i will update after a resolution.update:  07/25/23 (tuesday a/m)i just got off the line with brinly rep, he was attentive and friendly, promised to send out new parts the next day, so i couldn't expect better csr service.  will update if there are further issues, but for now, am very satisfied.update 08/04/23replacement parts arrived in two days, everything seems to be fine now.  this is not an exceptionally robust device but except for the hiccup initially, i am pleased with it.

I plan to engineer this  modification.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2022
review_content: MIRACLE HAPPINESS.pine trees can get bagworms that eat the pine needles, that wasnt my problem.  (if you do have any type of pine tree/ bush and have bagworms ugly black worms that turn into white moths, and eat the pine needles, or bush leaves, get bifiden) my problem was a fungus that makes  the needles fall off and from growing again called needlecast.  i have many pine trees and 3 were really bad 1 almost gone,  trying to save it.  after one dousing good application and fertilizer stakes to encourage new growth,  several that has some of this are like new.  2 of the 3 which were really bad are almost there, and 1 which was almost dead with no needles, I am trying to bring back.  the bad and kinda bad ones i did 2 applications so far  2 weeks apart, bc it rained a lot.  but this stuff kills the fungus and the needles come back.  it makes enough for me to use it for 5 years this little container.WORD TO THE WISE. after you mix this with water, only a couple oz are needed per gallon, use the mix, if you let it sit it gets ugly stick black,  use it and rinse the container out.dont spray near a white fence, will turn black.clean up any that spills when you mix right away and no problem.  its really dark blue.thought it would be green. was surprised.I am going to spray the really bad trees every 2 weeks until like new, and the ones with a little bit just april, june, and sept.also for really good growth and vibrant pines, put the fertilizer stakes in april after ground isnt frozen, and in sept.  i didnt fertilize them in sept. before but now i do.  much better looking trees.if you happen to smell it in the wind, you get a faint catpiss scent.  very faint.  dont spray too close to your house it can stain the siding, shingles, paint, or dont do it on windy day. I would imagine if you have to spray close to house, if you have garden house on and ready you can just rinse it off it you do it right away

review_content: It's very good at its job: killing fungus.  Took care of my fungal issues on my flowers right away.  And it's natural, so you can use it on crops without worrying about tainting your veggies or accidentally poisoning small critters.My only issue with it is this: why doesn't it come with a small measuring cup or eye dropper?  You have to dilute this stuff (it's in industrial strength concentration) and it's hard to measure without some kind of small measuring device and you most certainly do not want to use your kitchen stuff on this.  Farmers and serious growers aren't going to buy the 8oz version, they go larger.  This size is for the weekend warrior, and weekend warriors don't have $1.5k+ spray machines that auto dilutes the mixture.  The manufacturer should tape a small pipette or eye dropper to can so it's easier to measure out.

review_content: After searching to find something that would treat the many ails of this very fussy tree, I think this finally was a keeper.  After diluting per instruction, sprayed all surfaces - top and underneath - every leaf.  Spray once, then reapplied 7 days later, and one more time 14 days after that. It seems to have mostly stopped the scale and the leaf mildew.  The tree has definitely perked up, and thankfully, is flowering for the third time in as many months.  You have to be very careful with this solution. It is POISON to animals and not so great for humans either. Wear gloves, clean up any solution that drips onto the floor - and wash your hands.  Kind of a pain, but this tree is too, so yes it's worth it!!

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2012
review_content: We have been using Ortho home bug spray for several years now in order to keep a roach, scorpion & spider problem under control. We  hadn't really seen many roaches inside our house, except an annoying few during the night in our kitchen. The real problem was out in our back yard & back part of the house where there are prominent cracks in the foundation (old house) & less traffic. In the yard we have flies as well that we could not get rid of easily on our garbage cans (I tried insect spray, but once it gets wet from rain or the sprinklers outside it stops working).Well, I had read about Demon WP online searching for a way to get rid of Black Widow spiders & many people reviewed this product to kill many different bugs right on contact including black widows. Thankfully Amazon has it here because it isn't available in my town.The first spraying I just did a few choice spots to see if it would really work ( I was skeptical). I used 2 packets in a one gallon sprayer. The next morning we found a couple dozen bugs inside the back part of our house & the outside area were where the masses were dead.  Impressive.  So, I mixed up just one packet in a gallon sprayer & went around the inside & outside again focusing on all the cracks, perimeter & missing nothing.  The next morning we found more bugs than the first time. Now it has been a week since my initial spraying & we are still finding dead bugs, roaches, beetles, ants, spiders, moths & flies to name a few.Now I had the idea to spray our rental home that is semi vacant. There was a take over by black widow spiders in that house. It took one packet in a one gallon sprayer, full inside perimeter & just the area outside where the spiders were taking over, including the front porch perimeter. Next morning & every other morning after that we continue to find dozens of bugs dead before they made it into the front door, including the black widow spiders. That cleared up the bug problem.I had no idea this stuff would continue to work as well as it is. In the past we have tried sprays, powders & mixes that bugs became immune to or that quit working once it got wet from rain or the sprinklers. Demon WP does not stop killing bugs & when I say it kills bugs, I do mean it kills in masses if that's what you have crawling around your house like we did.I've re-ordered this larger pack, because the price to mix my own comes out less than buying a gallon of already mixed spray (that doesn't work as well). My plans now are to share this with my family who are having a serious bug problem & live in an old, cracked house with many places for bugs to hide. I would not recommend this to my family if it did not work. This stuff works better than any store bought product I have tried in many, many years & for the first time we do not have bugs in our patio, porch, or even the back parts of our house. We can sit outside & not be attacked by a crawly thing.Amazing feeling to know that one simple powder mix can & does eliminate a bug problem quickly as it does. Keep in mind that if you have a really bad problem with bugs, you will need to spray occasionally to keep the numbers down. I am going to continue spraying as well, too.One comment on the odor, this to me has no odor & does not burn my skin if I spill it on me. (be careful to wear gloves & keep away from your face though).Great product, excellent price & like the reviews state this stuff works.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2012
review_content: I moved to the desert early 2011 and within the first year had to call exterminators from 4 different companies. We had black widows the size of my thumb all around the house, hobos that sent me running, and ironically ended up with brown widows, wolf spiders and flying ants after months of treatments along with these little black beetles. It got to the point that we kept rubber mallets in the kitchen, bedrooms and bathrooms. I was told the infestation (the house had been vacant for over 2 years before we moved in) was so bad I had no choice but to tent it which I couldn't afford. Luckily no one has suffered a bite, so I started researching and found Demon WP reviews online and figured the $20 was worth the try before going in debt to finance tenting the house or medical bills.The first time we did it was in the garage to see if it even worked. We soaked the entire garage, which is unfinished with rafters exposed, along the floor line, ceiling connections and back and forth along the walls. The next day we were sweeping them off the floor so we did it again and had more the following day! The one place I didn't do, which is where they ran, was to all of the nooks in the rolling garage door so don't forget that. That weekend we did the perimeter of the house, around every window and door along with the perimeter of the yard. All I can say is that the desert has WAS too many bugs.I was concerned about spraying inside the house because I have dogs and cats so I called the manufacturer. They said once it dries its no longer toxic to them so I took everyone to the groomer for a few hours of pampering and came home to do the job. All rooms along the floor boards, around outlets, along windows and ceiling lines and inside all closets and cupboards (I was OK with running everything through the dishwasher over the next few days). I spent hundreds on exterminators in our first year here but then spent probably around $50 on this. We saturated the house (inside and out) and fence line the first few weeks then marked our calendar and do it the first weekend every three months and we have only seen 3-4 spiders in the last 6 months!The only thing better than this for the aggressive and toxic spiders is a hammer!UPDATE: I used this specifically for the toxic spider problem as mentioned above. I gave an envelope (4 pk) to a friend who has seen her spider problem multiply the last few years who said it didn't work for her after she did "all 4 treatments" this fall. After the first trial treatment I did the house and garage with 3 packets to a 2 gl sprayer then resprayed later with 2 packets to 2 gallons, she used 1 packet to 2 gallons of water four different times with little/no result.Even though its winter my son went over this last weekend and sprayed a heavier dose (3pk/2gl)in her garage where she still sees a few, the next morning she found 6 curled up on the floor dead so, I may be wrong and you can call the manufacturer, but a heavier dose may be needed for the more poisonous spiders. Last year we spent the winter with every bug in creation searching out a warm spot, this winter we haven't seen a single bug in the house or in the garage.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2022
review_content: Rule #1: Don't be a moron and spray ANY hazardous chemical solutions where your pets may come into contact with those chemicals. After moving into a house with a basement during the middle of winter (February) we were noticing quite a few bugs coming in to the 1st floor rooms. I don't blame them for wanting to get away from the snow & ice outside, but not into my house. So I used Demon WP downstairs around the entire perimeter of the basement at the top of all the walls, and at the top & bottom of the interior bearing walls. BAM! No more problem with bugs upstairs. For the next 9 months I had to walk around the basement once a month with a dust buster to vacuum up any dead bugs from the floor. I finally saw our first spider web after the initial treatment, so I sprayed the basement a second time in October. During that second 9 month period I rarely saw any dead bugs in the basement, and just the occasional stink bug upstairs that probably came in through an open window. I just did a 3rd treatment of Demon WP one month ago in July and so far over the past month I have only seen one dead bug in the basement, so it does appear to me that Demon WP creates a very effective barrier against bugs entering our basement, and when an insect does happen to breech the bug blockade, within a few steps of entering our basement the bug dies. So besides being a very effective insecticide, the protective barrier of Demon WP just goes on and on and on just like the Energizer bunny. I used two packets of Demon WP in two gallons of water to fully saturate and treat our 1500 square feet basement.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2022
review_content: Here in Florida, we have roaches the size of a Yorkshire Terrier.  Not really, but you get the idea.  During the dry season the roaches make their way in to homes searching for water.  They get into cabinets, drawers, bathtubs, sinks and anywhere else they can.  They are fearless and resilient.  We tried everything on the market to get rid of them.  At one of the stores I was visiting, in search for yet another miracle product, the associate suggested Demon WP. She explained the amazing results she had had and singing the praises of this product. So, as soon as I got home I ordered DWP along with a 1 gallon sprayer, you'll need one.  Demon WP was delivered about 4 days later and that night the battle was on.  We sprayed inside the whole house and the outside perimeter as well.  The next morning we found roaches flat on their backs.  After 4 days now...we haven't seen any of the critters lurking about.  This stuff works and it works well!  There is a slight odor from the DWP, but not anything that requires you to get out of the house.  No mess and no film.  One word of caution...if you have a garden and are planning to spray around it....please rethink.  I'm afraid that you might also be getting rid of any beneficial insects that may be about.  Would I purchase this product again?  Absolutely!  Would I recommend DWP?  You bet I would!
